cookingTips: Freeze bananas in advance by slicing and storing in freezer bags for convenient use and naturally creamy texture without excess ice
Add liquid first to prevent protein powder and dry ingredients from clumping on the blender blades
Blend spinach separately before adding other ingredients to ensure leaves break down completely and distribute evenly
Use truly frozen banana rather than fresh to achieve a thick, creamy consistency without diluting with excess water
Serve immediately after blending to maintain nutrient integrity and prevent separation of ingredients
enrichment.coachingPrompt: I'm making a Terminal Green Smoothie and need step-by-step guidance. The recipe has 8 ingredients including fresh spinach, frozen banana, avocado, vanilla protein powder, almond butter, unsweetened almond milk, ice, and optional honey. Key techniques include: adding almond milk first to prevent blade jamming, blending spinach on low for 10 seconds to break down leaves, then adding banana/avocado/protein/almond butter and blending on high for 45 seconds until completely smooth with no chunks, then adding ice for 15 more seconds. The total time should be under 5 minutes. Please walk me through each step with timing, explain why each step matters for the final result, and provide troubleshooting advice if the texture isn't right or ingredients aren't blending properly.
